trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates whether to look for byte order marks at the beginning of the file.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates whether to look for byte order marks at the beginning of the file.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Indicates whether to look for byte order marks at the beginning of the file.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

\nbufferSize is less than or equal to zero.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxxxXxxx$$xx$ xx xxxx xxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxx.

trans-unit.source: true to look for byte order marks at the beginning of the file; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a value that indicates whether the current stream position is at the end of the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if the current stream position is at the end of the stream; otherwise false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

\ntrue to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Returns the next available character but does not consume it.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An integer representing the next character to be read, or -1 if there are no characters to be read or if the stream does not support seeking.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xx xxxx$ xx $0 xx xxxxx xxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xx xx xxxx xx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Reads the next character from the input stream and advances the character position by one character.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Reads a specified maximum of characters from the current stream into a buffer, beginning at the specified index.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx x xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx x xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

When this method returns, contains the specified character array with the values between index and (index + count - 1) replaced by the characters read from the current source.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxx $$xx$xxxxx $ xxxxx $ 0$$xx$$ xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The index of buffer at which to begin writing.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The maximum number of characters to read.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of characters that have been read, or 0 if at the end of the stream and no data was read.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx$ xx 0 xx xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxx xx xxxx xxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The number will be less than or equal to the count parameter, depending on whether the data is available within the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxxx xxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The buffer length minus index is less than count.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxx xxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$.

trans-unit.source:
\n

An I/O error occurs, such as the stream is closed.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx X$X xxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Reads a specified maximum number of characters from the current stream asynchronously and writes the data to a buffer, beginning at the specified index.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx x xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xx x xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

When this method returns, contains the specified character array with the values between index and (index + count - 1) replaced by the characters read from the current source.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxx $$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ $ $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ $ 0$ xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The position in buffer at which to begin writing.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The maximum number of characters to read.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
If the end of the stream is reached before the specified number of characters is written into the buffer, the current method returns.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A task that represents the asynchronous read operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: The value of the TResult parameter contains the total number of bytes read into the buffer.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxx xx xxx $xx$XXxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the stream has been reached.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xx xx xxx xx 0 $xxxx$ xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The sum of index and count is larger than the buffer length.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx xx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The reader is currently in use by a previous read operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xx x xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Reads a specified maximum number of characters from the current stream and writes the data to a buffer, beginning at the specified index.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx x xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xx x xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

When this method returns, contains the specified character array with the values between index and (index + count - 1) replaced by the characters read from the current source.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxx $$xx$xxxxx $ xxxxx $ 0$$xx$$ xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The position in buffer at which to begin writing.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The maximum number of characters to read.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of characters that have been read.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The number will be less than or equal to count, depending on whether all input characters have been read.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxxx xxxx xx xxxxx xx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$$ xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The buffer length minus index is less than count.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxx xxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Reads a specified maximum number of characters from the current stream asynchronously and writes the data to a buffer, beginning at the specified index.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx x xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xx x xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

When this method returns, contains the specified character array with the values between index and (index + count - 1) replaced by the characters read from the current source.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxx $$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ $ $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ $ 0$ xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The position in buffer at which to begin writing.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The maximum number of characters to read.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
If the end of the stream is reached before the specified number of characters is written into the buffer, the method returns.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A task that represents the asynchronous read operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: The value of the TResult parameter contains the total number of bytes read into the buffer.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxx xx xxx $xx$XXxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the stream has been reached.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xx xx xxx xx 0 $xxxx$ xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The sum of index and count is larger than the buffer length.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx xx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The reader is currently in use by a previous read operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xx x xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Reads a line of characters from the current stream and returns the data as a string.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx x xxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xx x xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The next line from the input stream, or null if the end of the input stream is reached.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

There is insufficient memory to allocate a buffer for the returned string.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx x xxxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Reads a line of characters asynchronously from the current stream and returns the data as a string.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx x xxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xx x xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A task that represents the asynchronous read operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The value of the TResult parameter contains the next line from the stream, or is null if all the characters have been read.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxx xx xxx $xx$XXxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx$ xx xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The reader is currently in use by a previous read operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xx x xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Reads all characters from the current position to the end of the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

There is insufficient memory to allocate a buffer for the returned string.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx x xxxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Reads all characters from the current position to the end of the stream asynchronously and returns them as one string.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A task that represents the asynchronous read operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The value of the TResult parameter contains a string with the characters from the current position to the end of the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxx xx xxx $xx$XXxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx x xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The reader is currently in use by a previous read operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xx x xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.
